question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes. The Liangchibao mini-program code needs to allow on-site photo uploads with measurement data annotations, and special areas require text notes. Users publish measurement orders that staff members can accept and manage. There should also be backend management functionality. Please provide the complete detailed code.

checklist.title: Is the photo upload and measurement annotation system complete?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements the complete photo upload flow including camera access permissions, compression, preview, and upload. Check if the code provides an intuitive interface for adding measurement annotations (like lengths, areas) directly on photos. Verify if annotations can be visually represented (lines, markers) with measurement data (values, units). Score 0 if basic upload is missing, 5 if upload works but annotations are limited, and 10 if the complete system with visual measurement tools is implemented.

checklist.title: Is the special area text note function properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether users can mark special areas on photos and add text notes to these specific regions. Check if the implementation includes: 1) Area selection tools (rectangular/freeform), 2) Text input mechanism tied to the selected area, 3) Visual representation showing the connection between notes and areas. Deduct 3 points if area selection is imprecise, 5 points if notes aren't visually linked to areas, and 3 points if text formatting options are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the order publishing and management functions complete?
checklist.description: Check whether the code implements the complete workflow for users to create, publish and track measurement orders. Verify if the system includes order parameters (location, requirements, deadline, pricing), status tracking, and notification mechanisms. For staff-side functionality, confirm if order acceptance, status updates, and completion reporting are implemented. Deduct 5 points if the workflow has gaps, 3 points if notification system is missing, and 3 points if order history/tracking is incomplete. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the backend management system functional and comprehensive?
checklist.description: Assess whether the backend management system includes essential components: 1) User management (customers and staff), 2) Order oversight and intervention capabilities, 3) Data analytics and reporting, 4) System configuration options. Check if appropriate access controls and permission levels are implemented. Deduct 3 points for each missing major component, and 5 points if the admin interface lacks proper security controls. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as upload failures, network interruptions, invalid measurement inputs, permission denials, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-assisted measurement suggestions, 2. Augmented reality measurement tools, 3. Voice annotations for measurements, 4. Real-time collaboration between users and staff). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple photo capture mechanisms) 2. Function modules unrelated to measurement or order management (e.g., social networking features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating business logic/view/data persistence layers), component reusability, and WeChat Mini Program best practices. Deduct 5 points if global state management is chaotic; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if WeChat Mini Program lifecycle events are mishandled. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during photo manipulation, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
